title: Lithuania Is Shaken but Not Surprised by Russia’s Aggression in Ukraine
sub_head: The Baltic state, which joined NATO in 2004, has been warning for years about Putin’s imperial designs.
body:
Vilnius, Lithuania
Is Vladimir Putin unstable? Over 20 years the dictator earned a reputation as sometimes reckless but ultimately rational, a leader who took calculated risks to advance Russian interests as he understood them. But perceptions have changed amid his rambling speeches about Ukraine, paranoia over Covid-19, and references to nuclear war. “I don’t think he’s a rational actor,” judged former national security adviser H.R. McMaster. Sen. Marco Rubio recently tweeted, “Something is off with Putin.”
